data.title: Sunday morning Bloody Mary and Chicken Enchilada
data.text: A wide variety of choices for breakfast on the menu. Full Enchilada  breakfast is a lot of food, Enchilada, potatoes, eggs, and beans with red or green chili. All food is home made, and fresh. The Bloody Mary was a bit more spicy than I like. They make their own mix. Maria has been in the restaurant business a number of years and moved to this location a little over a year ago and has proved to have been a success.  Try the whole beans, so good. Hubby had breakfast burrito, excellent, but big serving. Stick with Mexican food and you can't go wrong. Locals eat here.

data.title: Good Mexican food in downtown Grand Junction
data.text: The location on a downtown side street corner was easily located. The hostess, server and busboy were outstanding. The food was as good as one could for Mexican style food.  The entertainer that evening was excellent with a wide variety of music for all tastes.

data.title: Best ever!
data.text: I'm not very experienced with authentic Mexican cuisine, but without a doubt tjis was the BEST Mexican food I've ever had! Couldn't stop telling my wife how much I enjoyed the chile relleno w/green sauce & the pork tamale with red. Don't miss out on the refried beans! The wait staff were prompt, courteous, efficient, and attentive; and the price was right. I would certainly recommend this restaurant highly!

data.title: Homemade beans are the bomb!
data.text: Best Mexican food in town!!!❤entertainment also on Friday and Saturday nights, he's great! The chicken fajita meat is so juicy and tender, nobody compares

data.title: A Hidden Gem
data.text:
The outside of this restaurant may be under remodeling or something, and was hard to see what it actually is.  Once inside, though, you definitely know where you are.
The food was very, very good!  Portions were great - in fact, the vegetarian burritos were huge!  Everything that was ordered was delicious!
Staff was friendly and courteous - great service.  Next time we are in Grand Junction, we will stop by there again!

data.title: It was okay.
data.text: This restaurant is located at 7th and Main Street in Grand Junction.  It has a small front door so it could be easily missed.  Eight of us went to dinner here on a Thursday evening.  Since we weren't very hungry my hubby and I shared a Pollo La Crema with refried beans, rice and 3 tortillas, though we only received 2.  Our food was just okay, I've had much better at other Mexican restaurants.  They also have a bar, but we didn't imbibe.  I didn't ask the others if they enjoyed their meal.  I have friends who come here frequently and they enjoy the food.

data.title: Machaca Sucks
data.text: If you are a Gringo and order Machaca you will be sorely disappointed.  They used dried beef and rehydrated which is traditional, but when doing so, it is supposed to be soft in texture and slightly salty. Here, it is like jerky, with hard scrambled eggs and no chiles or onions tossed in. Sucked. The beans are usually good, and the rice as well. My latest breakfast found soupy beans and the service to be lacking.

data.title: No Chain Food Here!
data.text: This is a local, family owned restaurant.  All the food is cooked from scratch, and your wait staff is likely to be a family member.  The atmosphere is informal, often with a solo musician in the evening.  I love the flan and the shrimp enchiladas!

data.title: Anniversary Dinner!
data.text:
We visited with (local to Grand Junction) friends to celebrate both of our Wedding Anniversarys. (They are 'new locals'.) They said this is as close to CHIQUITA'S (in San Diego) as they have found. It came pretty darned close but it's difficult to meet that standard!
We went on a Friday night, the atmosphere is happy, family, fun;musician playing and singing, customers chatting, laughing...perfect for our celebration.
The food was really good (see above!), the blended Margaritas were wonderful, flavorful (quite a choice of fruits as well!.) Although crowded and busy the service was prompt, all 4 of us received our dinners at the same time, always a plus!
Would definitely go back and would recommend...would also recommend taking our friends with you!

data.title: Yes!
data.text: Amazing meal! Mango margarita was excellent. Do not miss the tamales. The best i have ever eaten. Fajitas big enough to share. Marias is a hidden gem!

data.title: Always consistent-Wonderful flavors
data.text: If you enjoy authentic Mexican cuisine then you must try Las Marias Authentic Mexican Restaurant.  Their name says it all....."Authentic Mexican Cuisine".  We have eaten at Las Marias for over two years now and they are absolutely the best in Mexican restaurants in the Grand Junction, Colorado.  Consistently tasty and flavorful food, great service, friendly ambiance and authentic Mexican servers and "cooks".  Their enchiladas, tacos, mariscos (seafood) , burritos and care asada are the best you'll ever taste and, they are HUGE portions.  I'm a big eater and have never been able to finish my entree'....Maybe because I fill up on their "unllimited" chips and homemade salsa.  Try Las Marias and you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: This was wonderful and the price was right! The margaritas were delicious and only $3.50. I would go there again in a heart beat!

data.title: The best Mexican in Grand Junction
data.text: We live here, have Hispanic friends, and frequent Mexican restaurants in western Colorado and Easter Utah.  This place is simple simple, but also the very best we've found in the region.  I often stop for lunch here on the way to afternoon work for my wife's office

data.title: Authentic Mexican Food
data.text: Great service, good food.  We ordered take out.  We made a few special requests that were met with a positive attitude and accommodated.  The guacamole was good but needed a little salt. Both the green and red sauces were good.  I would return if back in the area.

data.title: Great place
data.text: Best in town, they take care you, great service. They give you huge portion. Best Mexican food in town.

data.title: best Mexican food in Grand Junction
data.text: Las Marias serves authentic home-made Mexican food.  The food is excellent (the best chili rellenos!), the service is friendly and efficient, and the price is very affordable.  Maria knows how to operate a first-class restuarant.

data.title: Amazing!!!
data.text: This is an amazing authentic Mexican restaurant! Great food and great service!! Best green chili in town!!! Breakfast is just as amazing as lunch or dinner! Best in grand junction!

data.title: Real Deal
data.text: Excellent Mexican food even by California standards. Large servings and great margaritas. Great fun and music too.

data.title: Yum!`
data.text: Stopped here on road trip from Oregon to Denver. It is a great find. The place is in downtown Grand Junction, so about a five minute drive off I-70 and away from the heartburn causing fast food joints. This locally owned place was nice and big and clean, had plenty of parking, AND the food was simply excellent. I had their pork green chile, and loved it so much I had to stop myself from asking for more. I would have liked to have brought a whole tub on it home, slapped it in the freezer, and taken it out for those nice rainy Oregon nights when nothing but a heavy dose of warming New Mexico chilies will warm me up. I HIGHLY recommend.

data.title: Great Mexican
data.text:
With some of the best happy hour deals and live music many nights, Maria's is the best Mexican place Downtown.

Their awesome margaritas don't even need Grand Marnier!
